Codetown has a unique concept of seating people in a train. Each train has N coaches and Coaches are indexed as 1,2,3... N as first , second , third .... N^th coach.
For each i^th coach if gcd of all pairs in the set    {i, i+1 ,    i+2} is 1 then the i^th coach is seated with i people. Else if gcd of any of the pair is not 1, then the coach will be kept empty.
Your task is to evaluate the no. of people a train with N coaches can accommodate.
for each train, coaches with indices N-1 and N will be kept empty.

Input

The first line contains the no. of testcases T.
Each of the next T lines contains an integer N denoting the no. of coaches in the train.


Output

For each test case print the no. of people the train with N coaches can accommodate.


Constraints

1 ≤ T ≤ 1000.
3 ≤ N ≤ 100000000.


Example
Input:
1
5
Output:
4

Explanation
In this case there are 1 person in 1^st coach and 3 people in 3^rd coach.
